answerText: Thomas de Quincey [10] His essay "On the Pleasure of Hating" was published in the collection The Plain Speaker in 1826, other essays, such as "On Genius and Common Sense" and "On Milton's Sonnets," appeared in the collection Table-Talk.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Stanford A and Maryland A and University of Illinois at Chicago | 2 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name some authors who, judging from the titles of their essays, might have been nasty people, for 10 points each.   [10] He wrote "On Murder as Considered One of the Fine Arts," but might be better known for his memoir Confessions of an English Opium Eater.
